Accomplished over the past weekend:
  • Transmission lines replaced (although, still leaking some. Probably just one of the fittings isn't tightened down properly)
  • Removed the air conditioner condenser
  • Installed transmission cooler
  • Oil change
Not bad for 4.5 hours... Also forgot to state that she turned 40,000 miles back on the 2nd of this month. :)

• "Fixed" cooling system leak (Will have to fix it again come cold weather)
  • Replaced driver's side window
Goal for the season is to get all the parts that I've got for her in the backseat.. installed into their proper spots.

need to find a way to stop smoking..
::sighs::

Normally, I do not interupt a book that I have been reading, as so I can read another one. At least not this year. I have been trying very hard to only have one book in the works at a time. 
Buuuut, I need to actually stop reading <u>Different Seasons</u>, as so I can read <u>Hell's Angels</u> by Hunter S. Thompson. It's for money and profit...

• Install right motor mount
  • Replace transmission lines
    •
  • Body mounts
  • Head gaskets
  • Repaint heads
  • Clean up and replace front bumper
  • Clean up and replace trunk lid (switch over the lock)
  • Install floor vents
  • Door seals
  • Buy new side mirror and install

So... after 6 months, multiple trips to the auto parts store, 2 days of work, 3 bolts cut off, 1 snapped off bolt, a few hours of P's help, 2 new motor mounts (although, only one installed currently)... I have a new exhaust manifold in my baby!!

She's all quiet again..
::purrs::

Trying to fix the exhaust manifold on my baby.. and failing to crack the bolts. 
I'm not having fun anymore. :|

I am finding myself starting to twist and turn in new ways within My Life. I am not entirely sure where I am going, or where I am going to end up, but what I do know is that the rest of the year is going to be interesting. I'm going to have to remind myself to take some leaps of faith.. and follow my heart.

Sometimes taking small steps is what is necc.. and sometimes, that's all time can allow. And always.. the show comes first.

<i>"Your outer journey may contain a million steps: your inner journey only has one:
the step you are taking right now. As you become more deeply aware of this one step,
you realize that it already contains within itself all the other steps as well as the destination."<?i>

::purrrrr:: His voice is soooooo sexy! I am smitten. ::le sigh::

Rain, Sleet, Snow, Freezing Rain, Etc Wintery Mix...

The Fates are working against me!

~ Learn from the past.
~ Don't repeat the mistakes.
~ Don't let the past dictate the Now.
~ Listen to your instincts.
~ Somethings don't change.
~ Hold onto Hope, but don't be stupid about it
"When you act out of persent-moment awareness, whatever you do becomes imbued with a sense of quality, care, and love - even the most simple action."

"All i need is 4 things in life 'Hope, Love, Faith, Forgivness'" Thanks to My Evil Imp..

What am I doing up at this hour?
Well, given that I've slept over 3/4<sup>th</sup> of the last 24 hours, I'm not all that surprised. 

Why have I slept this many hours?
I have no clue!

Is this going to probably screw with my sleep schedule come tomorrow night when I have to worry about getting up for work on Monday?
Probably.

::shakes her head a little bit::

If I didn't know better, I'd swear I had mono.

Think I'm going to go read for a bit.

I really should think about heading to bed soon. But part of me is like, "But you should be reading!" I am not completely understanding my mind right now. I was nearly falling asleep two hours ago, and now, now my mind just wants to read. Not even sure what I'd start reading, as I just finished off a book.. but it wants to read.
::shakes her head::

Silly mind.

Yesterday: a load of laundry
Today: Cleaning up some of my closet
Tomorrow: ??? (Perhaps my books?)

~ A warm bath
~ A nap
~ A nice, long, solid back massage
~ A good night of sleep
~ Spring
~ Pretty, comphy clothes
~ An evening of quiet
The next 2 or so hours are going to seem like an ETERNITY!!!!!!!!!

Slept like absolute crap last night.
Not surprised.

<i>"Ask yourself what 'problem' you have right now.
You can always cope with the Now, but you can never cope with the future -- 
nor do you have to. The answer, the strength, the right action 
or the resources will be there when you need it, not before, not after."
January: Confessions of an Ugly Step-sister by Gregory Maguire - Done The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown - in progress

I just remembered part of a dream that I had last night - I said to someone (not sure who it was) that everyone that I had met that day had been Buddhist, and that it somehow had come up in each discussion I had had that day. My mind flashed to each of the other 3 instances where I had had conversations and it had led to Buddhism. I was starting to comtemplate if there was any significance to it or not... I wish I could remember more.

I need to shake things up today. I'm not exactly sure how, but I do need to. Perhaps just me running some errands today will be enough to shake things up. ::fingers crossed:: I do know that I should not be trying to juggle finances at this hour in the morning. It'll just get me frustrated. Time to do my hair, grab an orange, and head off to work. I can't wait until it gets warmer out. ::sighs::

Not entirely sure what I need to do right now, but there is something that needs to be worked on a/o changed. My life currently feels stagnant, and I can't have that. That is not an option for me right now.

And sometimes, the Universe will hand things to me.
::evil grin::

Next step is mine.

There are things that need to be learned still, and things that I'm not going to subject myself to. I don't have to. Not anymore. 
Where am I? Where am I going? What am I going to do? I ask myself again and again. Do or Die, that's all I have.

Ice cold walks and sharp-knifed words. 
Is this what I really need?

I went to go get my new glasses today and while I was in Wal-mart (Yes, I got my glasses at Wal-mart..) someone decided to make my day! ::big smile:: I came out to my car to find a note underneath the windshield wiper. The note brought a huge smile across my face as I read it.. offering me anything I could possibly want (minus parts of the front end) off of a '71, 4-door Chevy Nova! FOR FREE!! The guy left his number and a quick note saying that he was in Wal-mart. I called him up nearly immediately and within a few minutes he and his wife had come outside to talk to me about their '71. Their 17yo son had taken it out and smashed up the frontend pretty badly. (Supposedly he ran into the side of a SUV and screwed up the Nova. ::shakes her head::) They don't have the time to do anything with it and they were just about ready to call a junkyard to have it hauled away! They saw me pull into the parking lot and decided to circle around the lot until they found my car. (They hadn't seen me get out of the car, so they had no idea who they were looking for.) I need to go take a look at it, but from what he says, the car is in amazing shape (except for the frontend), and I can have anything that I could possibly want off the car! (Including the shaved back doors!! ::purrs::) What I'd love to do (although is v. unlikely to be able to happen) is to just bring her home (she does run still!), store her someplace, and piece her out once the weather gets nice. But, I'll take what I can get! This makes for a v. happy girl!!

Perhaps I may need to think about getting a part-time job.

::ponder, ponder::

I may have very well have gotten the kick in the ass today that I've needed to take care of a couple of things. (Gods this isn't going to be easy!) Things to make My Life better. Things, that in the long run, will make *me* better. It's not something that I wanted to do, but I don't always get the choice when it comes to things that I have to do. None of us really do. For some reason, I'm scared. I feel like all of my experiences have been stripped away from me, and I am raw again. I know that I've done a lot of things, but I feel like I am starting all over again. (I am in many respects.) But this is a feeling that I'm not really sure if I like, or can fully explain. I feel like I'm a lot more vulnerable to everything that can possibly hurt me. (It's not even a fully vulnerable - the good can still hurt.) I need to look at this as a way to push forward. I've been trying to move myself forward for nearly a year now, and I feel like I haven't gotten anywhere. I very possibly haven't. It is always so much easier to continue moving "forward" by ways of inertia, instead of by effort. I need to put more effort into My Life! We will see what unfolds over the next month and a half..
"Remember to eat dessert first.. Live each day like it's your last." "Although, you can't survive on dessert."

A Georgia Peach and cleaning off my car. I wasn't looking forward to the first drive in the snow with my baby, but she did fine. (Then again, it was only three blocks and I was doing 20mph!) BUT.. that doesn't change the fact that she's been driven in the snow! I still need to go out and put her into a skid and pull myself out of it. <small>(I know how to drive in the snow, but it's a different game completely while driving a rear-wheel drive car, as compared to the previous front-wheel drive cars that I've owned. Or so I'm told.)</small>

I feel like I am going to be fairly productive today. I'm not entirely sure what I'm going to get done, but it feels like there is a lot of energy waiting in the wings. Just brimming under the surface, just waiting to be used. 

I also found myself expressing one of the things that has been bothering me slightly while on the phone this afternoon. It's nothing major, but it is something that does play into one of my decisions. (One of the big ones, at that!)

For now, I need to get lunch. Not entirely sure what I'm going to make/get, but, it should probably be soon.

And I'm feeling fine....

Sometimes, the reliance that I have to modern technology for communication annoys me. More, it annoys me when that technology doesn't work properly. I missed out on a conversation this evening that I was looking forward to having. It's become a bit of a "comfort" for me, to be able to login and chat with {D} most nights. Even if there are nights when most of the "conversation" is long periods of silence between actual conversation.. there is still a comfort there.

I think I'll be sleeping well this evening. A little bit of added help is always welcome when it comes to my sleeping. ::small sigh and smile::

And the reminders will be nice also..

This evening has held a very interesting and insightful conversation. One that I was not expecting to have, but one that has definitely given me a bit of a clearer view of some of the things that have been batted around in my head for the past month or so. I am going to have to let some of this digest a bit before I can actually do anything with what has been discussed.

A lot of open, heart-felt statements were shared, and with those, some new factors into my mind and my decisions of this year.

The first couple of days of the new year have been fairly "quiet". There has been a lot of time spent with friends, partying, and sleeping. But overall, it's been quiet. My mind hasn't been working on nearly the number of things that it normally does. I am not sure if that's because I'm giving it a rest, or it's giving me a rest. Either is a bit of a welcomed thing. There are a few things that have been weighing more on my mind than they have in the past, but I think for good reason (and in a good way). 

There are things that I need put my energy towards, and I think it's going to take a little bit of time, but I think that once I finally pull myself out of whatever little hole that I've been in for the past couple of months, I will be fine.

As usual, a little bit of time and energy.. and all will be well.

<i>"Nothing every happened in the past;
it happened in the Now.
Nothing will ever happen in the future;
it happened in the Now."
